column3: nitting: could you set a constant to that value instead of hunting and pecking for the number in case it changes again?

@instagibbs good point. `wait_until()` currently defaults to having *no* timeout. I can't see how that's useful - we'd want any timed predicate to eventually time out and fail the test. I propose we change `wait_until()` to have a 60 second timeout by default, and then remove the timeout parameter from almost all calls to `wait_until()` Definition is here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/m
@jnewbery Makes sense to me; I actually thought we already had a 60 second default and was going to suggest just using that when I saw @instagibbs' comment!
Updated `wait_until()` to have a default timeout of 60 seconds and removes the explicit timeouts from sendheaders.py
